title: Insular Gospel Manuscripts: Book of Kells & Lindisfarne Gospels
description: The pinnacle of early medieval manuscript art from Celtic Britain and Ireland: the Book of Kells's intricate illuminations and the Lindisfarne Gospels with its Anglo-Saxon interlinear gloss.

books.title: Book of Kells Latin Text (Codex Kenanensis)
books.author: Thomas Kingsmill Abbott

keyManuscripts: Book of Kells (c. 800 CE): Masterpiece of Celtic illumination from monastery of Kells, Ireland
Lindisfarne Gospels (c. 700 CE): Anglo-Saxon manuscript with 10th-century Old English gloss
Both represent the pinnacle of Insular art combining Celtic, Anglo-Saxon, and Mediterranean influences
researchValue: Essential for understanding early medieval manuscript culture, Celtic Christianity, and the transmission of classical learning through Irish and Northumbrian monasticism. The intricate knotwork and zoomorphic designs influenced European art for centuries.
